datasource.title: Data Sources
datasource.description: Below are the primary source data used and organized for this project (Google Sheets):
datasource.note: Note: The data is community-maintained and converted; it may contain manual edits or conversion errors. If you find issues, please report them or suggest fixes in the original data sheet.

project.title: Project Repository
project.description: The project source code and related resources are hosted on GitHub:
project.encourage: If you find this project helpful, please consider giving it a star on GitHub ⭐️ — it really encourages the maintainer!

amulet.noMatches: No matching charms found, please try different skill combinations
amulet.selectSkills: Please select skills to view matching charms

calculation.title: Calculation Method:
calculation.subtitle: Final Probability = Base Rarity Probability × Charm Type Probability × Skill Combination Probability
calculation.baseFormula: Base Rarity Probability: Fixed probability for each rarity level
calculation.typeFormula: Charm Type Probability: 1 / (Number of different skill group combinations in the same rarity)
calculation.skillFormula: Skill Combination Probability: Product of (1 / skill count) for each assigned skill slot

explanation.title: Detailed Explanation:
explanation.step1: 1. Each charm has 1-3 skill slots, each slot belongs to a specific skill group
explanation.step2: 2. Charms with the same rarity have different skill group combinations (e.g., [1,6,6], [1,7,null], [1,8,6])
explanation.step3: 3. The system assigns each selected skill sequentially to an available slot that contains the required skill group
explanation.step4: 4. Each slot can only be assigned to one skill (no duplicate slot usage)
explanation.step5: 5. For each assigned slot, calculate 1/(available skill count in that group) as the skill probability
explanation.step6: 6. Important: Already assigned skills in the same group are excluded, reducing available skill count for subsequent assignments
explanation.step7: 7. Multiply all individual slot probabilities to get the final skill combination probability

example.title: Example:
example.description: For a RARE[6] charm with groups [1,1,10] and selected skills [Artillery Lv.1, Attack Boost Lv.1, Weakness Exploit Lv.1]:
example.step2: • Charm Type Probability: 1/7 ≈ 14.29% (RARE[6] has 7 different group combinations)
example.step3: • Skill Combination: Slot1(Group1)→Artillery(1/35), Slot2(Group1)→Attack(1/34, excluding Artillery), Slot3(Group10)→Weakness Exploit(1/9)

calculation.groupCount: Skill Group Count: Total number of available skills in that group
calculation.charmTypeCounts: Charm Type Counts: RARE[5]=6 types ， RARE[6]=7 types ， RARE[7]=8 types ， RARE[8]=8 types

note.title: Important Notes:
note.line1: • This calculation assumes each skill in a group has equal probability
note.line2: • Skills cannot be repeated: Already selected skills in the same group are excluded, reducing available skill count for subsequent selections
note.line3: • Actual game mechanics may differ from this simplified model
note.line4: • Results are estimates for reference only, not guaranteed accuracy
note.line5: • Charm slot assignments follow a greedy matching algorithm
